cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi (230 km) SE of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast toward Nova Scotia and Newfoundland, remaining well offshore of the U.S. mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Halifax, Nova Scotia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Watches confined to Prince Edward Island and the Magdalen Islands (Canada); none posted for the U.S. mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for eastern Nova Scotia and portions of western Newfoundland; Tropical-storm warnings Woods Hole MA to Eastport ME
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England northward to Nova Scotia, Gulf of St. Lawrence, and Newfoundland
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: HYANNIS MA (closest site listed in table)
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of 25–35 kt gusts possible along the Virginia Capes as Dorian’s western outer band lifts northeast, diminishing through the day
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor tidal departures (<1 ft) along Chesapeake Bay entrances
weather_observation.rainfall: Generally less than 1 inch; most heavy rain shield remains north and east of the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells and dangerous rip-currents will continue to affect shipping channels and pilot transfer operations for another 24 h
